alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 630 PM MDT... At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Frenchtown to near Wye to near Missoula. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Wye, East Missoula, Frenchtown and Evaro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 90 and 107. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 6. Highway 93 S between mile markers 86 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
